anxiety.name: Anxiety Relief
anxiety.description: CBT-inspired prompts to help you notice anxiety patterns, triggers, and coping options.

seo.title: Anxiety Journal Prompts | CBT-Inspired Techniques
seo.description: Journal prompts for anxiety to help you identify triggers, challenge anxious thoughts, and find calmer footing.

gratitude.name: Gratitude & Positivity
gratitude.description: Cultivate thankfulness and joy with positive psychology prompts

seo.title: Gratitude Journal Prompts to Transform Your Mindset
seo.description: Daily gratitude prompts to help you notice what‚Äôs working, savor small wins, and build a consistent practice.

self-discovery.name: Self-Discovery
self-discovery.description: Deep prompts for understanding yourself better

seo.title: Self-Discovery Journal Prompts for Personal Growth
seo.description: Powerful questions to explore your values, identity, and direction through honest reflection.

prompts.text: What does anxiety feel like in my body right now? Where do I feel tension?
prompts.description: This prompt helps you identify physical sensations associated with anxiety. Body awareness is the first step in managing anxiety - you can't change what you don't notice.
prompts.aiSuggestion: After writing, click Get insights for an on-device emotional tone, theme, and reflection question.

prompts.text: What triggered my anxiety today? What happened right before I started feeling anxious?
prompts.description: Identifying triggers is crucial for managing anxiety. Most people can't see patterns until they write them down.
prompts.aiSuggestion: After writing, click Get insights for an on-device emotional tone, theme, and reflection question.

prompts.text: What's the worst that could happen in this situation? How likely is it actually?
prompts.description: Anxiety makes us overestimate danger. This prompt helps you reality-test your fears.
prompts.aiSuggestion: After writing, click Get insights for an on-device emotional tone, theme, and reflection question.

prompts.text: What evidence do I have that this fear is realistic? What evidence contradicts it?
prompts.description: This classic CBT technique helps you examine anxious thoughts like a detective.
prompts.aiSuggestion: After writing, click Get insights for an on-device emotional tone, theme, and reflection question.

prompts.text: If a friend came to me with this exact worry, what would I tell them?
prompts.description: We're kinder to others than ourselves. This prompt leverages that to reduce anxiety.
prompts.aiSuggestion: After writing, click Get insights for an on-device emotional tone, theme, and reflection question.

prompts.text: What's one small thing that made me smile today?
prompts.description: Starting with tiny moments makes gratitude practice sustainable. Big things are easy to forget; small moments stick.
prompts.aiSuggestion: After writing, click Get insights for an on-device emotional tone, theme, and reflection question.

prompts.text: Who is someone I often take for granted? What's one thing they did for me recently?
prompts.description: We adapt to people in our lives and stop appreciating them. This prompt fights 'hedonic adaptation'.
prompts.aiSuggestion: After writing, click Get insights for an on-device emotional tone, theme, and reflection question.

prompts.text: What's one challenge I'm facing that's actually teaching me something valuable?
prompts.description: Finding meaning in difficulty is the most powerful form of gratitude. This doesn't minimize pain - it honors growth.
prompts.aiSuggestion: After writing, click Get insights for an on-device emotional tone, theme, and reflection question.

prompts.text: When do I feel most like myself? What am I usually doing?
prompts.description: Your most authentic moments reveal your core values. This prompt helps you identify them.
prompts.aiSuggestion: After writing, click Get insights for an on-device emotional tone, theme, and reflection question.

prompts.text: What do I believe about myself that might not actually be true?
prompts.description: We carry childhood stories about ourselves that no longer serve us. This prompt helps you question them.
prompts.aiSuggestion: After writing, click Get insights for an on-device emotional tone, theme, and reflection question.

prompts.text: If money and others' opinions didn't matter, what would I do with my life?
prompts.description: Removing constraints helps you see your true desires. Most people have never honestly asked themselves this.
prompts.aiSuggestion: After writing, click Get insights for an on-device emotional tone, theme, and reflection question.

prompts.text: What's one thing I can control in this situation? What's outside my control?
prompts.description: Anxiety increases when we try to control the uncontrollable. This prompt helps you redirect energy.
prompts.aiSuggestion: After writing, click Get insights for an on-device emotional tone, theme, and reflection question.

prompts.text: What's my anxiety trying to protect me from? Is this protection helpful right now?
prompts.description: Anxiety evolved to keep us safe. Understanding its 'intention' helps you work with it, not against it.
prompts.aiSuggestion: After writing, click Get insights for an on-device emotional tone, theme, and reflection question.

prompts.text: What's something I use every day that I've stopped noticing?
prompts.description: We adapt to conveniences so fast we forget they're there. This prompt fights habituation.
prompts.aiSuggestion: After writing, click Get insights for an on-device emotional tone, theme, and reflection question.

prompts.text: What's a mistake I made that taught me something important?
prompts.description: Gratitude for mistakes is advanced practice. It transforms regret into wisdom.
prompts.aiSuggestion: After writing, click Get insights for an on-device emotional tone, theme, and reflection question.

prompts.text: What compliment do I have trouble accepting? Why might that be?
prompts.description: The compliments we reject reveal our deepest insecurities. This prompt brings them to light.
prompts.aiSuggestion: After writing, click Get insights for an on-device emotional tone, theme, and reflection question.

prompts.text: What would 10-year-old me think of who I am today?
prompts.description: Your childhood self had dreams unburdened by 'realism'. This prompt reconnects you with that innocence.
prompts.aiSuggestion: After writing, click Get insights for an on-device emotional tone, theme, and reflection question.

prompts.text: What's the smallest step I can take right now to feel 1% better?
prompts.description: Anxiety paralyzes. This prompt gets you moving, even if it's just sipping water or stepping outside.
prompts.aiSuggestion: After writing, click Get insights for an on-device emotional tone, theme, and reflection question.

prompts.text: What are three things I can see, hear, and feel right now? (5-4-3-2-1 grounding)
prompts.description: The 5-4-3-2-1 technique interrupts panic by anchoring you in the present moment through your senses.
prompts.aiSuggestion: After writing, click Get insights for an on-device emotional tone, theme, and reflection question.

prompts.text: When was the last time I felt calm? What was different about that moment?
prompts.description: Instead of fixating on anxiety, this prompt helps you reverse-engineer your calm moments.
prompts.aiSuggestion: After writing, click Get insights for an on-device emotional tone, theme, and reflection question.
